text:
Lets say that we have a sql:sqlDateParam tag that looks like this :
<sql:sqlDateParam value="${frdt}" type="date" />

where frdt is an object exported by fmt:parseDate

The following error is thrown :

org.apache.jasper.JasperException: An error occurred while evaluating custom 
action attribute "value" with value "Mon Jan 01 00:01:00 PST 2001": Attempt to 
convert String "Mon Jan 01 00:01:00 PST 2001" to type "java.util.Date", but 
there is no PropertyEditor for that type

creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com

text:
Created attachment 2521
Listing of the servlet that is generated by the JSP that threw this error
creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com

text:
You are apparently using the JSR-152 RI prototype with the "EL" version of the 
JSTL 1.0 classes.  This is not possible; the error is that the 'value' 
parameter for the date tag has type String because it expects a String 
expression, so when the EL code in Jasper2 itself looks at the attribute, it 
sees a type of Date, not String.  If you use a regular version of Tomcat 4.0.4, 
or if you use the "RT" version of the JSTL tags with the container you're 
using, the problem should go away.
creator: bayern@essentially.net

text:
OK,
So that means we canot use JSTL tags with the new Tomcat container until the EL
packaging is resolved.
Since I have jsp20el.jar also in there along with the standard.jar in the
WEB-INF/lib  of the webapp.
Comments ?
creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com

text:
1) It's not just jsp20el.jar; it's also the built-in container support for 
using calling the EL from the page-implementation class.

2) You can use JSTL, but you must use the "RI" libraries, not the "EL" ones.
creator: bayern@essentially.net
